Heading: Reviewer Self-Admitted Low Understanding vs Strong Judgment
Description:
Reviewer states:

“I probably didn’t understand this paper”

“I didn’t carefully check the math”

“I skimmed parts of the paper”

AND still gives a strong accept or strong reject recommendation

Heading: Review Length vs Strength of Decision
Description:
Review is <100–200 words but gives:

Strong Accept

Strong Reject

Heading: One-Sided Reviews (All Praise or All Criticism)
Description:
Review contains only positives or only negatives.

No mention of: Strengths and weaknesses.

One-sided reviews often reflect confirmation bias or emotional reactions.

Heading: Generic Criticism Without Evidence
Description:
Flag if reviewer uses repeated vague phrases such as:

“Unclear” , “Not convincing”, “Weak”, “Incremental”, “Lacks novelty”

AND

Does not cite: Section numbers or Figures or Tables or Specific claims

Heading: Harsh or Absolute Language Without Justification
Description:
Flag if reviewer uses language such as:

“Should not be published”, “Fundamentally flawed”, “Completely incorrect”
, “Useless contribution”

WITHOUT

Technical explanation or Evidence or References

Heading: Complaints About Experiments or Baselines Without Constructive Guidance
Description:
Flag if reviewer says:

“Missing baselines”, “Experiments are limited”, “Evaluation is insufficient”

BUT

Does not specify: Which baselines, datasets, metrics, prior work to compare against

Heading: Over-Focus on Minor Issues With Strong Negative Ratings
Description:
Review focuses heavily on:

Typos, Formatting, Writing style

While ignoring:

Core methodology, Results, Contributions

Heading: Confidence–Rating Mismatch
Description:
Low confidence score (e.g., 1–2)

Paired with extreme decisions:

Strong accept

Strong reject

Heading: Vague Claims About Missing or Ignored Prior Work
Description:
Flag if reviewer says:

“Authors ignore prior work”

“Well-known methods already exist”

“This has been done before”

BUT

Provides no citations.
